{"step_by_step_thinking": "Toll-like receptors (TLRs) are part of the innate immune system and play a key role in recognizing and responding to invading microbes. They are not induced by microbes, but rather they are already present in the body and become activated when they recognize specific patterns on microbes. Therefore, the answer is no, TLRs are not induced by microbes.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
